page.title: 14A HEADCORN CHILD'S WEEKEND
page.content: This is how we spend a weekend. Some of the family like to have a lie-in. At weekends they stay in bed a little longer. For breakfast on Saturday we usually have something light like cereal or a piece of toast. Some times we spend Saturday morning shopping for the rest of the week,usually going into Maidstone or Ashford to the supermarket or shopping centre. Many people still refer to Sunday as a day of rest but others use it as a work day,probably working in their garden or cleaning the car. For lunch on Sunday we have a larger meal than usual,often roast meat. In the after-noon we sometimes go for a walk through the fields using the public footpaths or perhaps we just relax and watch television. My older brother has homework to do before school again on Monday,but I enjoy my Sundays.
